aboutWork.title: About Scientific Work
aboutWork.author: Author: Dyachenko Danilo Oleksandrovych, 11th-grade student of the municipal organization (institution) 'Shostka Comprehensive Secondary School I-III levels No. 4 of Shostka City Council of Sumy Region'; member of the 'Radio Electronics' club of the municipal organization (institution) 'Shostka Young Technicians Station of Shostka City Council of Sumy Region'.
aboutWork.descriptionAdditional1: After the outbreak of a full-scale war, it became evident that ensuring a stable source of electricity has become one of the most pressing problems both in everyday civilian life and in military operations. Over the past two years, my research has been dedicated to the development of reliable sources of electrical energy to continually improve their characteristics.
aboutWork.descriptionAdditional2: Furthermore, due to the constant power outages that have been occurring in Ukraine for the third consecutive year, it was decided to focus efforts on the development of a more powerful, portable, and economically viable source of electrical energy to meet various daily needs and ensure reliable operation in the absence of the main power supply.

list.title: 1. Relevance of the Topic
list.content: The relevance of the chosen topic is determined by the possibility of effective implementation of an innovative, relatively inexpensive self-made station that can store electrical energy for a long period and be recharged. This device has found applications in both everyday household tasks and in emergency situations and military operations.

list.title: 2. Work Objective
list.content: The objective of this research work is to develop an affordable, easy-to-manufacture, and easy-to-use portable charging station. Another goal is to demonstrate its effectiveness and practicality in various situations.

list.title: 3. Main Tasks
sublist: 1. Selection of the necessary components for creating a charging station.
2. Development of the station itself based on the chosen components.
3. Experimental and theoretical confirmation of the possibilities of using the created device for various purposes.
4. Determination of the main technical characteristics of the station, comparison with industrial analogs, consideration of future project development directions, consultations with military experts.

list.title: 4. Object of Study
list.content: The object of scientific research is the developed prototype of a charging station as a high-efficiency source of medium-power electrical energy designed for charging various types of electrical devices.

list.title: 5. Subject of Research
list.content: The subject of the study is the exploration of the possibilities and advantages of using a self-made station designed to provide a stable and reliable source of electrical energy.

list.title: 6. Scientific Novelty
list.content: The scientific novelty of this research lies in the experimental creation of an innovative, relatively inexpensive medium-power station designed for multiple uses. The development has the potential to be useful in various areas, including domestic and household needs, military applications, tourist conditions, and in case of power outages.

list.title: 7. Practical Application
list.content: The practical application includes the ability to charge smartphones, laptops, tablets, flashlights, backup power sources, night vision devices, drones, and other electrical devices; use as an uninterrupted power source; for home lighting; in trenches, support points, checkpoints, and other locations with limited power supply.

list.title: 8. Work Conclusions
list.content: The important conclusions of this research include the successful production of an innovative, economically accessible medium-power charging station; conducting experiments using it for various needs; calculating the main characteristics of the device, determining its advantages and disadvantages, comparing it with analogs, selecting future project development directions, and successfully conducting consultations with military experts.

list.title: 3S, 4S, 5S
list.value: Designation for the number of connected elements in a battery (3, 4, 5 elements respectively)

list.title: PD
list.value: Power Delivery, fast charging technology for Type-C ports

list.title: QC
list.value: Quick Charge, fast charging technology for USB ports

list.title: XT-60
list.value: Type of connector for electronic devices

manufacturingProcess.title: Manufacturing Process of the «PUPS» Charging Station v.1

steps.title: Planning Future Features
steps.content: The main characteristics of the future station were preliminarily planned to meet our needs in its further use. These include: the ability to charge phones, laptops, drones; the possibility of power supply from a cigarette lighter socket through an adapter; the presence of a 220-volt network with average power.

steps.title: Purchasing Components
steps.content: The main components for its creation were selected and purchased, such as: inverter, case, charger, batteries, etc. The list of all purchased components and their prices is provided on the

steps.title: Developing the Connection Scheme
steps.content: Accordingly, the principal scheme of the planned prototype of the charging station was developed.

steps.title: Manufacturing the Battery Pack
steps.content: Lithium-polymer batteries with a voltage range of 3.7 – 4.2 volts and a capacity of 10000 milliampere-hours were chosen for creating the battery pack. To provide a higher capacity for the system, it was decided to make 3 separate battery blocks, each consisting of 5 batteries connected in parallel, providing a capacity of 50000 milliampere-hours for each. To increase the output voltage to the required 12.6 volts, the aforementioned three battery blocks were connected in series.

steps.title: Connecting to the Balancing Board and Wiring
steps.content: The battery system was integrated with a BMS board, which was modified to work in a 3S configuration. Two pairs of cables were laid from the battery and BMS board: one for current output and the other for the charging process.

steps.title: Insulating the Battery System
steps.content: The manufactured battery system was protected with plastic cardboard and additionally insulated with reinforced tape, providing protection from external factors and increased safety during operation. The overall dimensions of the completed battery system are 150x162x90 millimeters.

steps.title: Installing the Charging Board
steps.content: A module (board) of the charging device was installed in the case for charging the battery system. To prevent overheating during charging, a cooling fan is activated, which is also connected to the charging board. The charging device module has one red indicator LED, which signals that the charging process is ongoing.

steps.title: Managing Station Outputs
steps.content: A module (board) of the charging device was installed in the case for charging the battery system. To prevent overheating during charging, a cooling fan is activated, which is also connected to the charging board. The charging device module has one red indicator LED, which signals that the charging process is ongoing.

steps.title: Developing Inputs and Outputs
steps.content: The final stage of creating the charging station was the design and cutting of ports in the case. The case was used in a way that maximized the space for component placement while ensuring easy access to charging inputs and power outputs for various devices. The input for charging and the output for the inverter were located on one side, while other outputs, such as USB, charge indicator, and cigarette lighter output, were placed on top of the case for convenience.

additionalInfo.title: Special ventilation holes were also created in the case; mounting for the installation of various components inside the case. Photos of the developed prototype of the first version of the charging station can be seen by following the

components.title: Components of the «PUPS» Charging Station v.1
components.note: Prices are as of September-October 2023. Prices are considered without shipping costs.

manufacturedPrototype.title: Manufactured prototype of power station «PUPS» v.1

batteryChargeTime.title: Charging the «PUPS» v.1 accumulator battery
batteryChargeTime.description: Let's determine the battery charging time. The charging board accepts 220 volts and outputs 12.6 volts at 5 amps, meaning the batteries are charged with a voltage of 12.6 volts and a current of 5 amps. The station's battery was discharged to a voltage of 9.5 volts, which is the lower limit of the battery system's voltage. The station charged from 9.5 volts to 12.6 volts over approximately 9 hours.
batteryChargeTime.descriptionAdditional: The process of charging the charging station is shown in the photo below:

list.title: 1. Testing the 5-volt 1-amp USB port
list.description: The switch for the USB ports was turned on, and a Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 Pro phone with a 4500 mAh capacity was connected to the first USB. The phone was charged from 0% to 100%. The station's battery lost 4770 mAh. Not just 4500, as is the capacity of the phone's battery, but slightly more, since there is a 12 – 5 volt reduction module with 94% efficiency in the USB hub.
list.descriptionToFormule: = 4500 + 4500 * 6% = 4500 + 270 = 4770 - mAh spent on charging the phone

list.title: 2. Testing the 5-volt 2.1-amp USB port
list.description: A similar phone was charged using the 5-volt 2.1-amp USB port. Due to the higher current, the efficiency of the reduction module dropped to 93% (due to heating).
list.descriptionToFormule: = 4500 + 4500 * 7% = 4500 + 315 = 4815 - mAh spent on charging the phone

list.title: 3. Testing the cigarette lighter port
list.description: A 12-volt 48-watt 5-meter long LED strip was connected to the cigarette lighter port using an adapter, and the corresponding switch was turned on. The strip lit up, and then it was disconnected.

list.title: 4. Testing the 220-volt network
list.description: The switch for this output was turned on, and a charger for a Macbook laptop was connected to the port. The laptop's battery capacity was 6140 mAh. During the full charge of the laptop, the charging station's battery lost 8372 mAh. The determination of the station's battery capacity loss was conducted using a tester.

list.title: 5. Testing the charging station's charge indicator
list.description: The station's batteries were fully charged, and a voltmeter was connected to them, and the switch for the indicator was turned on. Initially, the battery voltage was 12.6 volts, and 4 segments of the indicator were lit. A 200-watt 220-volt incandescent lamp was used for the load. After 3 segments of the indicator lit up, the battery voltage was approximately 11.7 volts; 2 segments - 11.1 volts; 1 segment - 10.5 volts. The absence of segments, but still operational inverter - 9.9 volts.

chargeTime.title: Device Charging Time from the «PUPS» Charging Station v.1

list.title: 1. Determining the charging time of a phone from the 5-volt 1-amp USB port
list.description: The charging time for the phone was calculated using the 5-volt 1-amp USB port. The phone's battery capacity is 4500 mAh, which equals 4.5 Ah. The current of the USB port is 1 amp.
list.descriptionToFormule: = 4.5 / 1 = 4.5 - hours spent on charging the phone

list.title: 2. Determining the charging time of a phone from the 5-volt 2.1-amp USB port
list.description: The charging time for the phone was calculated using the 5-volt 2.1-amp USB port. The phone's battery capacity is 4500 mAh, which equals 4.5 Ah. The current of the USB port is 2.1 amps.
list.descriptionToFormule: = 4.5 / 2.1 = 2.1 - hours spent on charging the phone
list.descriptionAdditional: The phone charging process is shown below:

list.title: 3. Determining the charging time of a laptop from the 220-volt port
list.description: The charging time for the laptop was calculated using the 220-volt socket port. The laptop's battery capacity is 6140 mAh, which equals 6.14 Ah. The current of the laptop charging adapter is 3.3 amps.
list.descriptionToFormule: = 6.14 / 3.3 = 1.9 - hours spent on charging the laptop

chargeCycles.title: Device Charging Cycles from «PUPS» Charging Station v.1

firstListItem.title: 1. Determining the Working Capacity of the Battery
firstListItem.description: The capacity of the station used during operation was calculated. Considering that the effective capacity of the batteries is approximately 80%, and correspondingly 20% is the residual capacity of the batteries.
firstListItem.descriptionForFormule: = 40 Ah = 40000 mAh - working capacity of the battery

list.title: 2. Determining the Number of Phone Charging Cycles from a USB 5 Volt 1 Amp Port
list.descriptionBeforeLink: To determine the number of phone charging cycles from a USB 5 volt 1 amp port, a Redmi Note 8 Pro phone was used. On the page
list.descriptionAfter1: in section 1 'Checking the USB 5 volt 1 amp port,' the amount of capacity used to charge the phone from a USB 5 volt 1 amp port, that is Q
list.descriptionForFormule: = 40000 / 4770 = 8.39 - times the phone can be charged

list.title: 3. Determining the Number of Phone Charging Cycles from a USB 5 Volt 2.1 Amp Port
list.descriptionBeforeLink: The number of charging cycles from a USB 5 volt 2.1 amp port was determined. A similar phone was used for the experiment. The capacity spent on its charging amounts to 4815 mAh (section 2
list.descriptionForFormule: = 40000 / 4815 = 8.31 - times the phone can be charged

list.title: 4. Determining the Number of Laptop Charging Cycles from a 220 Volt Port
list.descriptionBeforeLink: To determine the number of charging cycles from a 220 volt port, a Macbook model M2 Pro 2023 was chosen. The capacity spent on its charging amounts to 8372 mAh (section 4
list.descriptionForFormule: = 40000 / 8372 = 4.8 times the laptop can be charged

instruction.title: PUPS Charging Station User Manual v.1

list.title: 1. Top View Schematic of the Station
2. Schematic of the Side and Front View of the Station
subUl: 2. Charging Input from a 220 Volt Socket

list.title: 3. Switch-Port
list.description: Each port is equipped with an individual switch. To activate the port, flip the corresponding switch to the linear position to turn it on. If the switch is in the circular position, it means the port is turned off.
list.descriptionAdditional: When you activate the USB port, an LED indicator lights up next to it. The cooler automatically turns on to signal the inverter's operation and the presence of voltage in the 220-volt socket. When connecting the charging station to a charging source, the fan activates automatically and a red LED lights up, which turns off after the station's battery is fully charged.
list.descriptionAdditional1: * The cigarette lighter socket is not equipped with an LED indicator.

list.title: 4. Safety Instructions
subUl: 1. Do not use the device near heat sources such as open flames or stoves.
2. Avoid contact with liquids. Do not immerse the device in water, avoid getting it wet. Do not use the device in the rain or snow.
3. Do not use the device in strong electrostatic/magnetic fields.
4. If you are not experienced in electronics, do not attempt to open the device. It is strictly forbidden to open the charging station while it is operating or charging.

5. When operating the device, strictly follow the working environment temperature requirements specified in this manual. High ambient temperatures may pose a fire or explosion risk; extremely low temperatures may significantly reduce battery performance or cause it to cease functioning.
6. Do not block the fan during operation. It is not advisable to leave the device in dusty, unventilated areas for a long time.
7. Protect the device from impacts, drops, or severe vibrations during operation. Immediately turn off the power and stop operating if subjected to significant external shock.
8. Keep the charging station out of reach of children and pets.

faq.question: What type of battery is used in your device?
faq.answer: It uses a high-quality lithium-polymer battery with a total capacity of 50 ampere-hours, 12.6 volts.

faq.question: What devices can be connected to the AC output port of this device?
faq.answer: The AC output port, with a rated power of 250W and a peak power of 500W, can power a portion of household appliances. We recommend checking the power of the appliances first and ensuring that the total power of all connected devices under load is below the rated power.

faq.question: How can I tell how much charge is left in the device?
faq.answer: The battery level indicator shows the current battery charge. If no segment of the indicator is lit but the indicator itself is active - that is, illuminated, it is recommended to recharge the charging station.

faq.question: Under what conditions can the PUPS charging station be used?
faq.answer: The charging station is designed for use in harsh conditions, including military operations and extreme situations. It is suitable for use in any weather, but its use during rain or snow should be avoided. If water gets inside the station, it is recommended to immediately turn off all switches, open the case, and dry the internal components.

faq.question: What should I do if a component of the station fails?
faq.answer: If there are problems with the operation of any port or switch, we recommend contacting us to arrange for repair. Attempting to fix the problem yourself is not advisable. We applied a modular principle in manufacturing, which means only the damaged component can be replaced without needing to repair the entire device.

faq.question: What is the recommended storage environment for the charging station?
faq.answer: The optimal place for storing the charging station is in a room with a temperature of 18 to 20 degrees Celsius. If the station has not been used for a long time, it should be fully charged before the next use.

faq.question: What should I do if the inverter turns off and the charging station stops working under load?
faq.answer: If the charging station suddenly turns off, it may indicate that it was overloaded. In such a case, first turn off all switches and disconnect all connected devices. Then, you can turn the relevant functionality back on, ensuring that the total power of the connected appliances does not exceed the inverter's allowable power.

transferMilitary.title: Transfer of the «PUPS» Charging Station v.1 to the Military
transferMilitary.description1: After the successful completion of the «PUPS» charging station's first version development, it was handed over to the military unit of the 45th Brigade of the 25th Separate Rifle Battalion (Photo below). Military specialists actively used this invention during military operations for two weeks. After this period, they provided us with feedback, noting the redundancy of the cigarette lighter port and issues with understanding how to charge devices among the team.
transferMilitary.description1additional: Their feedback is presented on the page
transferMilitary.description2: The detailed process of refining the «PUPS» charging station v.1 is presented on the page
transferMilitary.description3: Photo report of the military receiving the «PUPS» charging station v.1:

militaryReview.title: Military Feedback on the Transfer of 'PUPS' Charging Station v.1

listItem1.title: 1. Feedback on Receiving the 'PUPS' Charging Station v.1
listItem1.quote: "Yes, good day. We received such a 'can,' getting ready for combat departure from Danylo Diachenko with instructions. Thank you very much. It will be working right now. Send more if possible."
listItem1.description: Following this positive feedback and a request for another similar charging station, we decided to develop and manufacture another similar device. The development process is presented on the 'PUPS' charging station v.2 page

listItem2.title: 2. Feedback on Refining the 'PUPS' Charging Station v.1
listItem2.quote: "No need for more outputs, that socket... for the cigarette lighter isn't needed, so 2 – 4 USB fast outputs are enough and too many switches. My people... got confused about what to click..."
listItem2.description1: After getting the station back, we analyzed its condition after use in military operation conditions. Photos of the charging station after two weeks of use are presented on the page
listItem2.description2: . To improve functionality and meet the needs of military use as per their request, we made the following changes:

afterUsing.title: 'PUPS' Charging Station v.1 After Use
afterUsing.description: After receiving the station back, we conducted an analysis of its condition post-use in military operation settings, where signs of usage were evident.
afterUsing.descriptionAddtional: A photo of the received charging station is shown below:

additionalComponents.title: 'PUPS' Charging Station Components v.1.5
additionalComponents.description: Prices are as of September-October 2023. Prices are considered without shipping fees.
additionalComponents.descriptionAddtional: The cigarette lighter port was replaced with a fast USB hub QC 3.0.

improvements.title: Refinement of Shortcomings in 'PUPS' Charging Station v.1
improvements.description: To enhance functionality and meet the needs of military usage as per their request, we made the following changes: replaced the cigarette lighter port with two USB Quick-Charge 3.0 ports; for ease of use, added marker labels to the switches and ports with a white marker. As a result of these modifications, the updated station was upgraded to version 1.5.
